title:
A bifurcation and multiplicity result for a critical growth elliptic
  problem
authors: Said El Manouni and Kanishka Perera
abstract:
We consider a Br\'ezis-Nirenberg type critical growth $p$-Laplacian problem
involving a parameter $\mu > 0$ in a smooth bounded domain $\Omega$. We prove
the existence of multiple nontrivial solutions if either $\mu$ or the volume of
$\Omega$ is sufficiently small. The proof is based on an abstract critical
point theorem that only assumes a local $(\text{PS})$ condition. Our results
are new even in the semilinear case $p = 2$.
